update.description:
Allow setting marker colors using strings such as 'red' or '#ff8g80'.
If no colour is set, save the color as (-1, -1, -1), to distinguish 'no colour
set' from black. This way, actually setting the colour to black can be done,
whereas the BLACS progress bar can fall back to default colours if no colour has
been set (right now it uses default colours if it encounters black, precluding
one from actually using black).

If BLACS and runviewer are not updated after this change, they will encounter
colours that are (-1, -1, -1). They will not break, but they will print a
warning from Qt and will treat the colour as black. So this is fairly backward
compatible - the only visible consequence is the BLACS progress bar will be black
instead of blue for markers with no colour set, until BLACS is updated to be
aware of the change (I have tested that both apps are fine encountering shots compiled with this change).

Corresponding changes to BLACS and runviewer will make them aware of the
distinction between black and 'unset'.

This change uses PIL, which whilst present on Anaconda already, I will add to the dependencies in the installer. The pending LightCrafter DMD pull request also requires PIL, so its inclusion is not solely for this.

Since this is pretty simple, I will merge on Monday if there are no comments.
